rules: Rule1: If drug1 is approved, then it is marketed.
Rule2: Either drug1 is approved or it is not the case that drug1 is scheduled.
Rule3: Provided that drug1 is tested, it is reviewed.
Rule4: Under the condition that drug1 is reviewed, it is evaluated.
Rule5: Provided that legislation1 is passed, then if substance1 is restricted, it is banned.
Rule6: Either legislation1 is passed or it is amended.
Rule7: If drug1 is banned, then it is available.
Rule8: If substance1 is controlled, then drug1 is not banned.
Rule9: Under the condition that substance1 is scheduled, drug1 is not banned.
Rule10: Either drug1 is scheduled or, if legislation1 is prohibited, then drug1 is not available.
Rule11: Provided that it is not true that evaluated drug1 leads to it being controlled, then substance1 is restricted.
Rule12: If it is not the case that amended legislation1 implies restricted substance1 leads to it being banned, then legislation1 is repealed.
Rule13: If it is not the case that substance1 is controlled or scheduled, then substance1 is illegal.
Rule14: Under the condition that it is not true that the absence of substance1 being controlled or scheduled leads to substance1 not being illegal, then drug1 is tested.
Rule15: If it is not the case that the negation of substance1 being controlled or scheduled implies substance1 is not illegal, then substance1 is approved.
Rule16: Provided that it is not true that the negation of substance1 being controlled or scheduled implies substance1 is not illegal, then drug1 is not controlled.
Rule17: If it is not the case that not enacted legislation1 implies approved legislation1, then drug1 is banned.
Rule18: If legislation1 is not enacted, then it is not approved.
